access_log.title: Common Access Log
access_log.description: The default web access log format for servers like Apache.

sample.line: 10.112.72.172 - - [11/Feb/2013:06:43:36 +0000] "GET /client/ HTTP/1.1" 200 5778 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.17 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/24.0.1312.57 Safari/537.17"

block_log.title: Generic Block
block_log.description: A generic format for logs, like cron, that have a date at the start of a block.

syslog_log.title: Syslog
syslog_log.description: The system logger format found on most posix systems.

sample.line: Jun 27 01:47:20 Tims-MacBook-Air.local configd[17]: network changed: v4(en0-:192.168.1.8) DNS- Proxy- SMB
Jun 20 17:26:13 ip-10-188-149-5 [CLOUDINIT] util.py[DEBUG]: Restoring selinux mode for /var/lib/cloud (recursive=False)

TCF 29:47.191: Server-Properties: {"Name":"TCF Protocol Logger","OSName":"Linux 3.2.0-60-generic","UserName":"xavier","AgentID":"1fde3dd1-d4be-4f79-8090-6f8d212f03bf","TransportName":"TCP","Proxy":"","ValueAdd":"1","Port":"1534"}
TCF 30:11.475: 0: ---> C 4 RunControl getChildren "P1" <eom>

#+1375138067
echo HELLO=BAR

std.pattern: ^\[pid: (?<s_pid>\d+)\|app: (?<s_app>[\-\d]+)\|req: (?<s_req>[\-\d]+)/(?<s_worker_reqs>\d+)\] (?<c_ip>[^ ]+) \((?<cs_username>[^\)]*)\) \{(?<cs_vars>\d+) vars in (?<cs_bytes>\d+) bytes\} \[(?<timestamp>[^\]]+)\] (?<cs_method>[A-Z]+) (?<cs_uri_stem>[^ \?]+)(?:\?(?<cs_uri_query>[^ ]*))? => generated (?<sc_bytes>\d+) bytes in (?<s_runtime>\d+) (?<rt_unit>\w+) \((?<cs_version>[^ ]+) (?<sc_status>\d+)\) (?<sc_headers>\d+) headers in (?<sc_header_bytes>\d+) bytes \((?<s_switches>\d+) switches on core (?<s_core>\d+)\)(?<body>.*)

sample.line: [pid: 24386|app: 0|req: 482950/4125645] 86.221.170.65 () {44 vars in 1322 bytes} [Tue Jan  3 05:01:31 2012] GET /contest/log_presence/shhootter/?_=1325592089910 => generated 192 bytes in 21 msecs (HTTP/1.1 200) 4 headers in 188 bytes (1 switches on core 0)
